imbattuto dal 1998

Жарким летним июльским днём 1997 года я уезжал домой из славного города Теплодар. Чтобы не скучать в дороге, я заранее припас журнал о компьютерных играх — GAME.EXE.

Главная тема номера, вынесенная на обложку, называлась «Убить Quake или в очереди к палачу». В статье рассказывалось об играх метящих на звание «убийца Quake»: Prey, Unreal, Quake 2, Duke Nukem Forever, The Weel of Time, Hexen 2, Daikatana, SiN и... Half‑Life!

Именно тогда, в пыльном и душном автобусе, в уже помятом журнале я увидел скриншот, мгновенно заставивший поверить в реальность изображённого там мира. Помните, печатали такие стерео-картинки, в которые надо было долго вглядываться, выкручивая глаза наизнанку, пока не увидишь там какое-то объемное нечто? Примерно так было и с этим скриншотом. Только выкручивать ничего не пришлось, это было «раз и всё», как комарик укусил.

Я увидел живой, интересный мир, в котром жил чувак в жёлтом угловатом защитном костюме. Он остановился перед дверным проёмом в каком-то коридоре, но мне нестерпимо захотелось пройти дальше, завернуть за угол и посмотреть — что там? И я пошёл. Не сразу. Прошло чуть меньше двух лет, прежде чем небожители из Valve впустили меня в этот мир. Пошёл по его коридорам, лабораториям, военным базам, пограничным мирам…

Зуд от «укуса комарика» не проходит до сих пор. И, уверен, что не пройдёт, пока на то не будет воля заморских небожителей. Если они поставят точку — всё закончится. Если не поставят — зудеть будет вечно.

Exelente!

Alright, this game is my first real experience with the FPS in general. Back in 2004 when i got the demo disc on my hands,  i promptly clicked on the hazard course mode and tried my best to understand his mechanics, then i immediatly jumped into the demo (called Uplink by the way) and finished under 1 hour in hard mode, i was pretty proud of myself.
But then i contacted my friend who got an another demo of the game, this time featuring the first 4 chapters of the game, i was impressed by it's cutscene at the time and though this was cutting edge. Again back there i've got only a Pentium III, 128megs of ram and a Geforce 2 with no experience in 3D Games and no internet connection.

I've waited 4 years until i got the full release of the game, and then it was a blast :

- Graphicly, its an evolution, comparing to what we got in 1998 (like Thief,SiN,Quake II and Unreal), the system requirement needed atleast a pentium 133 and 24 megs of ram with a accelerator 3D card to display its capability like :
Real-time Shadows, Coronas, dynamic lightning on the player model,particules and much more advanced technologies from 1998.

- Gameplay wise, the pace of the action is slower than Quake, and follow the path of an scripted FPS of today, with puzzles mechanics and cutscenes (the player is still on control over his character during every cutscenes of the entire game by the way), the action involve an advanced AI system who got a lot of strategic formation, use wisely their crates or sandbags (replace this by any other props that the marines use against you) to avoid your shots, they try to coordinate their attacks against you and fall back when they are heavily wounded, that was mind blowing the first time i played against those AI marines, while the aliens are pretty basic but still deadly. Numerous traps awaits Gordon Freeman in his quest to his escape from Black-Mesa.

-Life time is short in this game, i finished it in 6 hours here on hard mode but for the first time, it took me 10 to 12 hours to complete it on easy (what ? No, I'm not ashamed by this, atleast i didn't cheated !), but then when you go to the multiplayer section with his various modifications you can be there for a long time...

-The soundtrack is pretty good, the first time i didn't have the music, but the ambiance was nice. It use the A3D technology to simulate reverbation, this mean that if you shot a bullet from the pistol in a vent it will have a different sound than if you shooted inside a giant room.

-The scenario was a good follow up, this was the first time that i didn't used the manual to understand easily this one, the cutscene explains everything, same goes for the characters.


Conclusion :
This game deserved a sequel, and that sequel deserve a sequel for me. 

Do i recommand it ? Well this game aged well, mostly for the gameplay and not the graphics anymore, but atleast it deserves to be completed.

Half-Life, the origins of many great shooters. Whether it be directly related (cough CSGO cough) or influenced, this game has defined the singleplayer shooter genre. While it may not look amazing (You can get Black Mesa, that looks great and is HL1 on the HL2 engine) the gameplay is still amazing.
Now i know why people want half life 3 best game ever
Best game of all time in my option. so much replay value

Hey, this game came out in 1998. Still plays as good as it did back then(probably, I only got it in 2015). It's a classic, and if you don't have it, think about picking it up. It's only $10, after all, and gives you hours and hours of playtime. Additionally, the multiplayer is great, and while you may have to put some effort into finding a server with players, it's well worth it. Rate 10/10.

This deserves 14,000 positive reviews. The best shooter game of all time (After Half Life 2 of course). It doesn't even require that big of a system, and if you want to finish it fast, then go right ahead, as it has one of the biggest speedrunning communities out there.
10 хеткрабов на голове и 10

Это была моя первая игра которую я полюбил. Мне было тогда 5 лет, может быть больше, и тогда у меня была пиратка. Я играл с читами, ну так как я же маленький был, так что ничего страшного) С этой игры всё вот это и началось: CS, Opposing Force, HL2, CS:GO, TF, Gmod и т.д.

我是最近才知道这款游戏的，之前一直不知道cs是它的mod。这个游戏用惊艳来形容丝毫不为过，难以想象在那个年代的游戏可以创造出这么复杂的AI（我玩普通难度都死了好多次2333），如果你认真去玩，会发现很多很有趣的东西，比如敌人是有很多不同的语音的等等等等。还有让我欣慰的一点就是居然有国语配音，虽然配音质量。。。。作为玩了这个和起源引擎的半条命，我更建议去玩起源引擎的那个，那个比较适合我的手感（个人感觉）。
Half-Life is good. It doesn't look good, but it doesn't need to. It's fun, and it makes up for the aging.
Everyone that likes games needs to play this one.
